thread.title: Budget 2016 Plans for Rural Areas to Get 20Mbps Internet
thread.title_full: Budget 2016 Plans for Rural Areas to Get 20Mbps Internet

author: Najwa
title: Budget 2016 Plans for Rural Areas to Get 20Mbps Internet
text:
Home > News > Budget 2016 Plans for Rural Areas to Get 20Mbps Internet Budget 2016 Plans for Rural Areas to Get 20Mbps Internet / source: http://www.treasury.gov.my 
The presentation on Friday was met with mixed response as the government unveiled its Budget 2016 plan. 
As part of the Budget 2016 presentation last week, the Malaysian Prime Minister, Najib Razak announced that the Malaysian Communication ans Multimedia Commission (MCMC) will put RM1.2 billion into improving the telecommunication infrastructure in the country. This includes increasing the broadband speed in rural areas from 5Mbps to 20Mbps. 
The budget would also cover high-speed internet projects, undersea cable system and national fibre backbone infrastructure. What is missing is any changes to broadband pricing as demanded from certain groups and consumers. 
The Budget 2016 also includes prepaid rebates for users based on the GST amount although some telcos have voiced their concern about the lack of details in the execution of this plan. What is certainly welcomed was the abolition of GST charge on prepaid card reloads effective on 1 November 2015. 
No rebates or exclusion has been given to postpaid users, which may see an increase in prepaid mobile users in the coming months. Share PC.com Malaysia Dawn of a new era.
